column4: I can't boot from my drive, I mounted the drive in the Live CD, and my files are here, but I think the OS is messed up. I crashed during an update. How can I fix this?
Whats the error message you get when trying to boot from your drive?
Could you please give a full error message when trying to boot from your drive in a pastebin?
would something like target file does not have sbin edit mean someting to you?
That means, that your installation is entirely broken, since there is no /sbin anymore.
is there any way to install over it and save my files and settings?
No. Use a liveCD to backup everything you want to preserve.
Did you create a backup of the files you wanted to preserve?
Thats not an answer to my question.
You just said you cant see your files anymore - how can you back them up then?
You cant do an upgrade on a broken installation. Expected behviour.
Again: You cant upgrade a broken installtion.
